ILight.h

This file defines the published base interface for dealing with various types of lights

ILight

Defines a properties common to all lights

Module

import Rendering.Caustic.ILight;

Functions
GetType
virtual ELightType GetType() = 0

Returns the type of light

GetOnOff
virtual bool GetOnOff() = 0

Returns whether the light is currently on

SetOnOff
virtual void SetOnOff(
bool f
) = 0

Returns a light on or off

Parameters
f
bool

if true, turn light on. Otherwise turn it off

SetIntensity
virtual void SetIntensity(
float intensity
) = 0

Sets the lights intensity (some rough notion of radiant intensity) This value falls off as intensity/D^2 (where D is distance in meters from object to light)

Parameters
intensity
float

intensity of light

GetIntensity
virtual float GetIntensity() = 0

Returns the lights intensity (some rough notion of radiant intensity) This value falls off as intensity/D^2 (where D is distance in meters from object to light)

Return

Lights intensity

SetCastsLight
virtual void SetCastsLight(
bool casts
) = 0

Indicates whether this light illuminates the scene. By default all lights do, however it is possible to create a light that only is used for shadow calculations by turning this flag to false and CastsShadows to true.

Parameters
casts
bool

True if light should participates in illuminating the scene. False otherwise.

GetCastsLight
virtual bool GetCastsLight() = 0

Returns whether this light participates in illuminating the scene

Return

True if light does participate in illuminating the scene. False otherwise.

SetCastsShadows
virtual void SetCastsShadows(
bool casts
) = 0

Indicates whether this light participates in shadow mapping

Parameters
casts
bool

True if light should participate in shadow mapping. False otherwise.

GetCastsShadows
virtual bool GetCastsShadows() = 0

Returns whether this light participates in shadow mapping

Return

True if light does participate in shadow mapping. False otherwise.

SetPosition
virtual void SetPosition(
Vector3& pos
) = 0

Sets the position of the light

Parameters
pos
Vector3&

Position of the light in world coordinates

GetPosition
virtual Vector3 GetPosition() = 0

Gets the position of the light

Returns

Position of the light in world coordinates

GetDirection
virtual Vector3 GetDirection() = 0

Gets the direction the light is pointing. For nondirectional lights this will return a zero vector

Returns

Direction of the light in world coordinates

SetDirection
virtual void SetDirection(
Vector3& dir
) = 0

Sets the direction the light is pointing. For nondirectional lights this will be a zero vector

Parameters
dir
Vector3&

Direction of the light in world coordinates

SetColor
virtual void SetColor(
FRGBColor& color
) = 0

Sets the color of the light

Parameters
color
FRGBColor&

Color of the light

GetColor
virtual FRGBColor GetColor() = 0

Gets the color of the light

Returns

Color of the light
